subject: Re: execute a single testXx method from text-based test runner?
msgSnippet: I should have made myself clearer. Certainly creating a testsuite would work. However, I find it a bit inconvenient: one has to write / modify some java code

I should have made myself clearer. Certainly creating a testsuite
would work. However, I find it a bit inconvenient: one has to write /
modify some java code to do so, rather than directly specifying in
command line.

- sam
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "veny" <veny@p...> wrote:
> Hi Sam,
> 
> How about using TestSuite? Use a TestSuite and just add that one
particular
> test method to the TestSuite.
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Veny
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: orionlee [mailto:orionlee@y...]
> Sent: Saturday, January 31, 2004 5:28 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] execute a single testXx method from text-based test
> runner?
> 
> 
> hi,
> 
> From time to time during debug, I only want to execute a single testXx
> method  rather than the entire Test class.
> 
> The current text-based test runner does not seem to provide the
> functionality.
> 
> I have two questions:
> 1. is there some well-accepted recommendation on dealing with such a
> scenario?
> 
> 2. if the answer to (1) is no, it seems that the text-based test
> runner can be (somewhat) easily enhanced to accomodate the case (I
> have done that for my own use). What is the process to feedback such
> enhancement back to junit base?
> 
> Thanks!
> 
> - sam
> 
> 
>
